Package net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math

Interface PiecewiseConstant

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPiecewiseConstant, Combiner.CombinedPiecewiseConstant, PiecewiseConstantHours, PiecewiseConstantSpecificDays, PiecewiseConstantWeekday
public interface PiecewiseConstant
A piecewise constant function defined on a LocalDateTime axis.

This abstraction is intended to model human workload allocation over time. In many planning scenarios, a person's effective contribution is constant over a given period (for example, a week, a sprint, or a contractual interval), and may change only at discrete boundaries.

  • Method Details

    • segmentAt

    • iterateSegmentsFrom

      Iterator<Segment> iterateSegmentsFrom(LocalDateTime instant, TimeDirection direction)
      Returns an iterator over segments in ascending chronological order, starting from the segment that contains the given instant.

      Important: The first segment returned by this iterator is the segment that contains instant, but this segment does not necessarily start at instant. The segment may have started before instant and extends beyond it. Subsequent segments follow in chronological order.

      This method is intended for efficient forward traversal when computing or aggregating workload over time windows without materializing all segments.

      This iterator may represent a large or conceptually unbounded sequence, depending on the underlying workload rules.

      Parameters:
      instant - the instant from which to begin iteration; the first segment returned will be the one containing this instant
      Returns:
      an iterator over segments containing and following the given instant
